body_html:
https://github.com/caffe2/caffe2.git is a few months out of date. The code moved to https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git

This path in your error message "/home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/caffe2/python/" tells me that you are still trying to run Caffe2 out of your build directory. You should not run your commands from your root Caffe2 directory (which should actually be the root pytorch directory now) or from your build directory; this is because the presence of directories called 'caffe2' confuses python; python should import Caffe2 from its own site-packages, not from the source files. This https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-do-i-get-import-errors-in-python-when-i-try-to-use-caffe2 and the next few questions should help you avoid many Python problems.

Can you

  1. Make sure you are using the most current code in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch if you want to build from source. If you don't need to edit the source code or build from source, then you don't actually need to clone any code at all. You can just the pre-built packages.
  2. Create a brand new conda environment, see the link above for the right way to do that
  3. Try a simple "conda install -c caffe2 caffe2" in the new environment.
  4. Make sure your Python environment is clean. Again see the link above. Make sure you don't have environment variables set that you don't need.

This path in your error message "/home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/caffe2/python/" tells me that you are still trying to run Caffe2 out of your build directory. This https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-do-i-get-import-errors-in-python-when-i-try-to-use-caffe2 and the next few questions should help you avoid many Python problems.

Try a simple "conda install -c caffe2 caffe2" in the new environment.
Make sure your Python environment is clean. Again see the link above. Make sure you don't have environment variables set that you don't need.
body:
https://github.com/caffe2/caffe2.git is a few months out of date. The code moved to https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git 

This path in your error message "/home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/caffe2/python/" tells me that you are still trying to run Caffe2 out of your build directory. You should not run your commands from your root Caffe2 directory (which should actually be the root pytorch directory now) or from your build directory; this is because the presence of directories called 'caffe2' confuses python; python should import Caffe2 from its own site-packages, not from the source files. This https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-do-i-get-import-errors-in-python-when-i-try-to-use-caffe2 and the next few questions should help you avoid many Python problems.

Can you
1. Make sure you are using the most current code in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch if you want to build from source. If you don't need to edit the source code or build from source, then you don't actually need to clone any code at all. You can just the pre-built packages.
2. Create a brand new conda environment, see the link above for the right way to do that
3. Try a simple "conda install -c caffe2 caffe2" in the new environment. 
4. Make sure your Python environment is clean. Again see the link above. Make sure you don't have environment variables set that you don't need.
